reviewText: This isn't an ARPG in the vein of diablo/path of exile/etc. The loot is limited, the abilities are heavily limited, and the combat is pretty boring. This is some ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ offshoot of the original genre with none of the factors to keep veterans of ARPGs interested, and nothing so good it will hook new players. People who just want a combat RPG should look elsewhere, and people who want a loot fest should stay away.\n\nIt doesn't take long to recognize, the equipment slots are thus - armor which just gives you a flat boost, destiny cards which give you a generic stat boost (5% dmg, 5% more crit, etc), and weapons which decide your moveset. There are no talent trees, no real stats (the only stats this game contains are defense, damage, crit chance, and crit bonus), and no depth. Once I had played for 5 minutes I recognized that the moveset on the shotgun I had been using would be the same moveset I would be using for the entirety of the game if I had continued.

- เกมเพลย์เป็นเกมแนว Action RPG, Hack 'n' Slash จริง ระบบการควบคุมทำได้ดี คล่องตัว มีการกระโดหลบทำให้เกมดูรวดเร็วเป็นแอคชั่นมากขึ้น แต่อาวุธชุดเกราะบอกเลยซ้ำซากมีไม่มากและไม่แน่ชัด ทำให้ไม่มีจุดหมายว่าจะต้องเอาเกราะนั้น ดาบนั้นมาให้ได้ เลยมีแต่ความว่างเปล่าอันไหนดีก็เอามาใส่ๆ ให้มันชนะ ไม่มีสายให้เลือก อันนี้ถือว่าไม่มีผลเพราะเราสามารถเลือกเปลี่ยนอาวุธใช้ได้ตามใจชอบ แต่อาวุธก็มีไม่มากแบ่งเป็น ดาบฟัน ดาบแทง เคียว ปืนลูกซอง ปืนยิงระเบิด ปืนไฟฟ้า และค้อน ซึ่งอาวุธไม่ได้แบ่งธาตุแต่มีสกิลเฉพาะ อาวุธแบกได้ 2 อันสลับกันใช้ได้อย่างรวดเร็ว(รออาวุธอีกอันสะสมสกิล)  สกิลเวทย์นั้นก็มีจำกัดอยู่ไม่มากแบ่งตามธาตุ แบกได้ทีละ 2 สกิล ใช้ต่อกันได้สูงสุด 2 ครั้ง ตามแถบพลังงาน และยังมีสกิลตัวละครอีกแต่ไม่ได้ให้อัปนะ แต่จะเป็นการ์ดแทน เลือกใส่ได้ตามใจ ถอดขายได้...
- เนื้อเรื่องค่อนข้างที่จะจืด ก็เป็นปรกติของเกมแนวนี้ แต่ก็ไม่ได้มีผลต่อการหักคะแนนแต่อย่างใด เพราะเล่นเอามันส์อย่างเดียว...

สรุป ให้คะแนนที่ 4.5/10 หัก 5.5 คะแนนเพราะค่อนข้างที่จะซ้ำซาก ไม่มีอะไรที่ดึงดูดให้เข้าไปเล่นมากนัก ชุดเกราะมีน้อย อาวุธซ้ำแบบ ถึงแม้จะมีระบบให้อัปเกรดของเอง แต่มันก็ดูยุ่งยากเสียเวลาไม่น่าทำอยู่ดี ส่วนตัวแล้วยังไม่แนะนำให้ซื้อเกมนี้เพราะมันยังไม่สุดพอรอให้ลดซัก 40 เปอร์เซนต์ขึ้นไปก่อนค่อยซื้อมาเล่น...

Victor Vran ก็พอที่จะมอบความสนุกให้ผู้เล่นได้บ้าง แต่มันก็ยังไม่พอที่จะทำให้ผู้เล่นได้หลงใหลเท่านั้นเอง...

reviewText:
The 1 major selling point for this game, has to be the atmosphere.
The sound design, the level design, the level of detail, the animations, the voice acting (Geralt, people!), the special effects, it's all brilliant. It's so good, that after about an hour or 2 playtime, I need to quit the game and just sit and stare for a bit, to slow my heartrate a bit.

I guess some people might not like the fact that there isn't really a class system in this game, but on the other hand, you get dynamic class switching. All you do is open your inventory, change your load out, and you've changed your entire playstyle. It's really cool to experiment with all the different weapons - and so far, I've seen quite a few different ones.

There're a ton of dungeons, and also a random generated gauntlet type (I haven't been there yet, it unlocks at level 26 and I'm only 16), but it basically is a dungeon that increases difficulty through 5 stages.

The game has co-op as well, up to 4 Victors can play together. I dunno how this works either, but people seem to enjoy it, random grouping as well as with friends.

For 20 bucks, this game isn't expensive considering the amount of content you get. Anything cheaper, especially below 10 bucks, could be considered a steal/insta-grab.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
EDIT: developers have been trying to isolate and fix bugs. Kudos to them for trying, as of yet the freeze has not occured, yay! Guys. Lots of edits, I bought this game when it was new, several updates since then, I urge you to read through this review to get a fair estimate of the game.

EDIT: had to change this review to a not recommended due to the X freezing bug. It's a fun game, but it's broken under Linux. It'll be uninstalled until I see this specific bug fix in the changelogs. Tropico had a very similar problem, no other game does, it's all on the devs to fix this now.

This game is fun! I gotta admit, I was hesitant because my experience with Tropico 5 wasn't good, but I chanced my money because of the fantastic art style in the game and I was very pleasantly surprised.

You like dungeon crawling? Loads of randomized loot? Special attacks, bonuses, spell casting, bashing, slashing and dodging? It's all in here! Haeimont proves that dungeon crawlers can be fun, engaging and beautiful, still making them relevant in 2015.

Unlike other titles in the genre, Victor Vran offers a dynamic realtime game mechanic, whether you're using a controller or mouse + keyboard the controls are crisp and responsive, it almost feels like a high quality platformer in that regard. Good thing the controls are crisp, because you will need to be nimble on your feet to survive these dungeons. It's much more than a hack and slash, it offers a varied range of tactics, if you mindlessly rush in and just mash buttons the game will punish you.

I like the voice acting (it really works for this game), the music is fantastic and the art work spectacular. Everything is put together in this nice package that compels me to explore and try different tactics. There are a few things that could be better for multiplayer (separate loot instances are not my cup of tea), but nothing that would keep me from playing online. It's still a blast to complete the different quests and missions with your friends.

All this said, they still need to iron out a few bugs on Linux. Just as with Tropico 5, the game will freeze and lock your X display when you have the highest graphical settings, forcing me to use the lowest settings and even then there are the occational crashes and texture bugs.
I'm hoping the developers will actually fix this because the art style is fantastic, I rarely enjoy/miss shiny graphics, but for this game I really want to use my GTX880M to it's fullest. Victor Vran deserves... Nay, Victor Vran demands it!

Remember kids, the only sparkles you'll see on a vampire is the gold it drops when yous shoots it!

reviewText:
Got this through Humble Bundle, which included the dlc, minus the soundtrack/artbook dlc.

It feels like a Diablo 3 clone with camera control. Abilities change depending on the weapon you use. Powerful abilities can be changed based on the demon power drop. The story is intriguing. You only get one character. The beginning of the game is your tutorial while once you get to the Hub, you pick a class for your character, Victor Vran. There are 3 class types for him. It comes down to your play style. There's 3 difficulties you can pick, 2 of which you can survive if you are careful. The third is if you want a challenge, but I've yet to even try that. I might finish this game and then pick hardcore.

In a nutshell.
Diablo 3 clone with camera control.
1 character, Victor Vran.
3 class types.
Abilities based on weapons.
Demon powers can change.
Game is fairly easy.

Update.
Oppa Gangnam Style!
Find this easter egg.

reviewText:
The 1 major selling point for this game, has to be the atmosphere.
The sound design, the level design, the level of detail, the animations, the voice acting (Geralt, people!), the special effects, it's all brilliant. It's so good, that after about an hour or 2 playtime, I need to quit the game and just sit and stare for a bit, to slow my heartrate a bit.

I guess some people might not like the fact that there isn't really a class system in this game, but on the other hand, you get dynamic class switching. All you do is open your inventory, change your load out, and you've changed your entire playstyle. It's really cool to experiment with all the different weapons - and so far, I've seen quite a few different ones.

There're a ton of dungeons, and also a random generated gauntlet type (I haven't been there yet, it unlocks at level 26 and I'm only 16), but it basically is a dungeon that increases difficulty through 5 stages.

The game has co-op as well, up to 4 Victors can play together. I dunno how this works either, but people seem to enjoy it, random grouping as well as with friends.

For 20 bucks, this game isn't expensive considering the amount of content you get. Anything cheaper, especially below 10 bucks, could be considered a steal/insta-grab.

reviewText:
This game was a lot better than I expected.  Very similar to Diablo II; better in most ways, worse in a few others.  For an indie game, this has great graphics, decent replay value, and a good amount of content (kept me occupied for over 25 hours in my first playthrough, not including elite challenges).  Linux performance is great, too.  Read any of the positive reviews and they'll tell you all you need to know about what makes this a great game that's worth buying (it definitely is worth buying).  But I do have a few complaints:

1.  The ability to dodge is great and something I use all the time, but shields would've been a nice option too.  Very often I'll find myself in a situation where dodging damage is simply unavoidable.  Considering there are some challenges expecting you to make X amount of kills without getting injured or stay above Y% life, this gets to be pretty annoying.
2.  There seems to be a poor balance to the weapons.  The shotguns, scythes, and rapiers seem to be overpowered while the hammers, swords, and mortars are almost uselessly weak.  Considering each weapon type has it's own set of advantages, this also makes certain challenges nearly impossible to achieve.
3.  Gold is pretty much worthless.  Your inventory is unlimited, there are all sorts of items to help increase your gold count, and you can easily find everything you need that is as good or better than what you can get from the merchants.  The only thing I ever found myself spending gold on were transmutations.  The gold could've been more useful if you had a limited capacity in your inventory, and if the merchants had better things for sale.
4.  Though the level of detail in each level is great, having at least some of the maps randomize like they do in other games would've been nice for replay value.
5.  I'm not sure why, but this game seems to be seriously lacking bass in my surround system.  It doesn't seem to take advantage of the rear speakers either.  Not a big deal, just a little weird that only 3 of my 6 channels were used.

reviewText: Rating: 7/10\n\nWhen I first saw the game, I thought this was a Van Helsing clone (Can't argue with the familiarity). But when I finally got the game, I could see the difference. The game has the stereotypical charm of an ARPG like Torchlight, but the developers have changed a few things for the game to stand out from the others. The jump mechanism has been added in the game which surprisingly works well in this genre where all you do is click to other areas to evade attacks. Along with this change, there are a lot of changes to the control scheme of the game that tries not to decrease the life span of your mouse with incessant clicks (Though they are still pretty much there). Full voice acting is a welcome addition to the game and it's done well. Character progression has been also done differently as you don't invest in skill sets, but acquire powers from time to time as loot or purchases (Each weapon has a different powerup as well). The major gripe I have with this game is the variety. After playing for 2 hours or so, you feel like you have experienced what the game is all about. Games like Torchlight present you with abundant variety for you to remain glued to the game for hours unlike this one. However, the challenges in the game might ameliorate this deficiency if you have OCD like me. Would definitely recommend a purchase at a discount.

At the time of writing, I'm about 3/4 of the way through the game.

If you're looking for a Diablo style game, Victor Vran might be it. It has a simpler game mechanics (not necessarily a bad thing) but a better story, IMO.

The game has 5 different hexes that can be enabled to make the game more challenging, and each one enhances the monsters in different ways.

The game should provide about 50-60 hours of fun, unless of course you're an achievement ♥♥♥♥♥ then you'll get a lot more out of it.

reviewText:
This is a AAA game masquerading as a B-Rate film in video game form, and it is much better than I expected.

A lot of users cover the mechanics in their reviews, which are actually pretty ♥♥♥♥ing deep, so I'm going to tell you quickly about the theme and style:

Victor Vran is the video game every B-Movie junkie wishes they knew about.  At first, you will probably think that the cheesy voice acting and awkward plot are just a good dev making a bad mistake.  I did, and I was wrong.  Since  Haemimont Games are responsible for the Tropico franchise, I should have known better.  They obviously set out to make a B-Game, and they ♥♥♥♥ing hit it out of the park.  The more you settle in to this one, the more it'll worm it's way in to your favorites.

The setting is a bit Victorian Gothic, and Vran looks and plays like Diablo combined with Devil May Cry.  The voice acting is a touch wooden, but not over-the-top.  Just enough to fit the tongue-in-cheek vibe of the narrative, and it progressively improves as you start to realize the intent behind this game.  Speaking of narration, the narrator himself is just about my favorite part of the game.  He keeps up running jokes, an interesting dialogue, and (of course) drops some references to just about every leg of gaming/nerd culture that can be comfortably fit in to the game's narrative.  The plot does dip in a place or two, but nothing worth noting.

I can not recommend this game enough to anyone who enjoys ARPGs, Classic Horror, B-Movies or just a well-tuned game that doesn't take itself too seriously.  Now, as far as those game mechanics I mentioned earlier, this is the fastest rundown I can give you:

Several different weapon and ability types, all of which function differently, allowing you to really fine-tune your playstyle.  The game looks great and runs great, and the movement and mechanics are mostly pretty sound.  You might miss a jump here and there, or be bothered by the lack of inversion for camera movement, but it ain't gonna kill you.  Good enemy variety, great music, online co-op (local announced but not implemented), PvP, a Survival Mode, Hardcore Mode, and the constantly changing Cauldron of Chaos that provides a steady stream of new challenges and killer loot.  Transmutation, for those that are familiar with the item mechanic, is pretty solid.  There are also Bounties and Treasure Hunts (shareable between players, ffs!), and there are no ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ inventory restrictions, although inventory management can become a pain.

I'm forgetting ♥♥♥♥, and I know it.  I don't care.  Buy the damned game and find out what I missed, because it's ♥♥♥♥ing worth it.

reviewText:
Very fun game, Victor Vran was a fun, fast action paced arpg.  You have a variety of different weapons to use at will, equiping any two at a time and have the ability to swap between them in combat.  You also have two potion slots, and two (spell?) slots.  Each weapon will have a basic attack and two special attacks.  Then as you build overdrive you can use your spells, which according to how you build your character they can assist you in many different ways.  The next thing you have is destiny cards.  These basically sum up your attributes in a way.  While one might give you 100 crit damage, the other one might give you 5% crit chance.  The slots for destiny cards has to be unlocked and there is a point system on how you can equip them (the higher level destiny cards cost more points.)

So after that, the loot.  You get lots of weapons, destiny cards, and spells but i believe the only three pieces of armor I had gotten were from quests.  There are a lot of similar creatures throughout the whole game.  Skeletons, spiders, essences, vampires, and maybe a couple more.  There were no blood in the game, so it made a better choice to play with my younger son.  Most of your defense will be from dodge-rolling out of the way of danger.

Your weapons damage and stats can be increased by transformation.  Combination of three spells can upgrade the weapons stats, then certain runes will increase the damage.  The story did not take too long to beat and this is another one of those games where you can keep putting the difficulty up, leveling, completing challenges  and dont forget playing coop with others online.

Victor Vran was a fun game for me and I would recommend it if you like hack&slash dungeon crawler type games.

reviewText:
Victor Vran is the most enjoyable top-down RPG I've ever played. Gameplay-wise, think of it as Dark Souls III and Diablo III in one.
The developers did a tremendously good job of balancing the game. I've played for a quite a while (disregard the number of hours noted above, I've played offline for a considerable amount of time) and It's not so hard that you'll die time and time again, It's just hard enough to keep things fun and interesting.

I really think Destiny cards add a huge aspect to the gameplay, as well as being able to choose what demon power you want to use. This means that you can always be molding your abilities into exactly how you want them.
It's a great feeling to utterly obliterate a huge group of enemys with a single blow. In Victor Vran, you can do that and much, much more.
